de.dfki.embots.behaviorbuilder
Class BehaviorBuilder

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      de.dfki.embots.behaviorbuilder.BehaviorBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
BBConstants, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public final class BehaviorBuilder
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.lang.Runnable, BBConstants

The Behavior Builder is an interactive tool to quickly create behaviors like gestures from a sequence of poses that are formally defined in EMBRScript.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Parameters:

sendBehavior

public void sendBehavior()
Sends the single behavior to the agent, so it be carried out instantly.

sendText

public void sendText()
Send the content of the EMBRScript textarea to the agent, so it be carried out instantly. The textarea is editable, so this can be used for experimenting and debugging.

getSequenceScript

protected java.lang.String getSequenceScript(boolean forSaving,
                                             int fromPose,
                                             int toPose)
Generates and fetches the sequence script out of the sequence table and the there defined poses. Possible manual editings of the script in the EMBRScript textarea will be ignored in this operation.

Parameters:
forSaving - if true, applies time warp that is set in the GUI to start and hold times of poses

updateScript

public void updateScript()
Updates the EMBRScript in the TextArea of the GUI.

Parameters:
showSequence - whether the script should be re-assembled beforehand

saveBehavior

                            int fromPose,

Save single behavior (lexeme/gloss). Allows to specify start/end poses for partial export.

Parameters:
file - Target file.

Save whole behavior list.

saveBehaviorDialog

protected boolean saveBehaviorDialog()
Show a save dialog to let the user destin the file to write the generated EMBRScript to. Asks user permission before overriding an existing file.

Returns:
True is dialog was cancelled!

createHeadPane

public static javax.swing.JComponent createHeadPane(java.lang.String title,
                                                    javax.swing.JToolBar toolbar)
On-the-fly creation of a pane's header field comprising - a title - a toolbar Recommended use (as by #createUI(java.awt.Container)): aPanel.add(createHeadPane(paneTitle, predefinedToolbar), BorderLayout.NORTH) If you want to change the appearence/layout of the panes headings, you shoeld most probably change it here.

Parameters:
title - desired title
toolbar - an existing toolbar

public static javax.swing.JComponent createSeparator()
On-the-fly creation of a horizontal separator, to use e.g. in toolbars.

Parameters:
width - the separation gap width
Returns:
the created separator

enrichActionFromProperties

public void enrichActionFromProperties(javax.swing.Action a,
                                       java.lang.String key)
Attaches attributes to action. The attributes are determined by entries in the configuration file. The following are set: - title: the title (also the caption) of the corresponding control - descr: a short description, typically displayed as a hover tooltip - image: an image icon (if file exists) to be displayed at controls - mnemo: a hotkey (a standard modifier plus the defined character)

Parameters:
a - the previously defined action to be enriched
key - the decisive part of the key in the properties file

public void enrichAction(javax.swing.Action a,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         javax.swing.KeyStroke keyStroke)
